alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 25 at 6:36AM AKST until December 26 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...STORM WILL BRING HEAVY SNOW TO THE HIGHWAYS... .A surface low will bring a strong front into the Panhandle through Monday. The surface low is expected to move inland somewhere between Cape Fairweather and Sitka. This storm track will set up the Haines and Klondike Highways to see heavy precipitation. Snow will begin to fall along the highways early Monday morning with heaviest snow expected Monday evening through late Monday night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 15 inches. Winds gusting up to 30 mph. * WHERE...Klondike Highway near White Pass. * WHEN...From 9 AM Monday to 9 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult and is discouraged unless it is an emergency. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Exact storm track will dictate how much precipitation will develop along the highways. If the storm tracks further south or west, snow accumulations will be less.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
